result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey L. Griffin

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on July 28, 2023 at 10:45 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:30 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Peter Prusinski.

Date and Time set for a FPT; parties have reached an agreement and wish to plea today.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA to Ct.1(DC/Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis;

COURT withholds finding and entry of guilt - Court adopts written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to the Court.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.1;

DEOJ RH set for 7/28/23 at 10:45 am.
Bond continues.

Adj: 9:36 am.
ATTIC Domestic Violence Program Recommendation Letter

Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s):  SR.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police (MNSO) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.  Third party child exchange through the family resource center.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:59 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

SR makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): SR. 
- Police (MNSO) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center. 


BRANCH 3 CASE.

FPT: 7/28/2022 at 9:30 am.

Jury Trial: 9/8/2022 at 9:00 am.
